newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria names ex-minister anti-graft task force head.
newsitem.headline: Algeria names ex-minister anti-graft task force head.

text.p: Algerian President Liamine Zeroual on Saturday appointed former justice minister Hamdani Ben Khalil as chief of a government watchdog to fight corruption, Algerian television said.
The newly created anti-graft task force is officially known as the National Observatory of Supervision and Coordination Against Corruption.
Ben Khalil, a 55-year-old lawyer and former regional lawyers' union president, was minister of justice between 1991 and 1992.

Zeroual, who was elected with more than 61 percent of the vote in last year's presidential poll, promised voters to wipe out corruption blamed for nurturing a lack of trust between average Algerians and their leaders.
